Instruction: Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a bowl. Blend in the butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the eggs and mix well.
Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes elastic. Allow the dough to rest for 1 hour.
Heat oil in a deep-fryer to a temperature of 375°F (190°C).
Shape each piece of dough into a rectangle and then cut it into 8-inch long and 3/4-inch wide strips. Form each strip into a loose knot before frying.
Fry cookies in hot oil in batches until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar and honey, if desired. Enjoy hot or cold. Store any leftovers in an airtight container.
